subject: Mental Health
title: The Anxiety Spectrum
description: A quick, practical guide to The Anxiety Spectrum.

hook.text: Anxiety isn't an on-off switch. It's a dial from mild unease to full panic.

buildup.text: At the low end, anxiety sharpens focus and improves performance on tasks.

discovery.text: The Yerkes-Dodson law shows moderate anxiety boosts performance but too much kills it.

twist.text: The same system that helps an athlete peak can paralyze a student mid-exam.

climax.text: Where you land on the spectrum changes daily with sleep, stress, and context.

punchline.text: A little anxiety helps. A lot can freeze you.

quiz.question: What does the Yerkes-Dodson law describe?
options: Moderate anxiety boosts performance but excess harms it
